traits.label: name
traits.name: :name
traits.desc: Used to specify the name of the control; Useful if dealing with forms; If not specified, it takes the value of 'for' prop, if it exists

traits.label: mask
traits.name: :mask
traits.desc: Custom mask or one of the predefined mask names

traits.label: fill-mask
traits.name: :fill-mask
traits.desc: Fills string with specified characters (or underscore if value is not string) to fill mask's length

traits.label: reverse-fill-mask
traits.name: :reverse-fill-mask
traits.desc: Fills string from the right side of the mask

traits.label: unmasked-value
traits.name: :unmasked-value
traits.desc: Model will be unmasked (won't contain tokens/separation characters)

traits.label: model-value
traits.name: :model-value
traits.desc: Model of the component; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'update:modelValue' event) OR use v-model directive

traits.label: error
traits.name: :error
traits.desc: Does field have validation errors?

traits.label: error-message
traits.name: :error-message
traits.desc: Validation error message (gets displayed only if 'error' is set to 'true')
examples: Username must have at least 5 characters

traits.label: no-error-icon
traits.name: :no-error-icon
traits.desc: Hide error icon when there is an error

traits.label: rules
traits.name: :rules
traits.desc: Array of Functions/Strings; If String, then it must be a name of one of the embedded validation rules

traits.label: reactive-rules
traits.name: :reactive-rules
traits.desc: By default a change in the rules does not trigger a new validation until the model changes; If set to true then a change in the rules will trigger a validation; Has a performance penalty, so use it only when you really need it

traits.label: lazy-rules
traits.name: :lazy-rules
traits.desc: If set to boolean true then it checks validation status against the 'rules' only after field loses focus for first time; If set to 'ondemand' then it will trigger only when component's validate() method is manually called or when the wrapper QForm submits itself

traits.label: label
traits.name: :label
traits.desc: A text label that will “float” up above the input field, once the field gets focus

traits.label: stack-label
traits.name: :stack-label
traits.desc: Label will be always shown above the field regardless of field content (if any)

traits.label: hint
traits.name: :hint
traits.desc: Helper (hint) text which gets placed below your wrapped form component

traits.label: hide-hint
traits.name: :hide-hint
traits.desc: Hide the helper (hint) text when field doesn't have focus

traits.label: prefix
traits.name: :prefix
traits.desc: Prefix

traits.label: suffix
traits.name: :suffix
traits.desc: Suffix

traits.label: label-color
traits.name: :label-color
traits.desc: Color name for the label from the Quasar Color Palette; Overrides the 'color' prop; The difference from 'color' prop is that the label will always have this color, even when field is not focused

traits.label: color
traits.name: :color
traits.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

traits.label: bg-color
traits.name: :bg-color
traits.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

traits.label: dark
traits.name: :dark
traits.desc: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

traits.label: loading
traits.name: :loading
traits.desc: Signals the user a process is in progress by displaying a spinner; Spinner can be customized by using the 'loading' slot.

traits.label: clearable
traits.name: :clearable
traits.desc: Appends clearable icon when a value (not undefined or null) is set; When clicked, model becomes null

traits.label: clear-icon
traits.name: :clear-icon
traits.desc: Custom icon to use for the clear button when using along with 'clearable' prop

traits.label: filled
traits.name: :filled
traits.desc: Use 'filled' design for the field

traits.label: outlined
traits.name: :outlined
traits.desc: Use 'outlined' design for the field

traits.label: borderless
traits.name: :borderless
traits.desc: Use 'borderless' design for the field

traits.label: standout
traits.name: :standout
traits.desc: Use 'standout' design for the field; Specifies classes to be applied when focused (overriding default ones)

traits.label: label-slot
traits.name: :label-slot
traits.desc: Enables label slot; You need to set it to force use of the 'label' slot if the 'label' prop is not set

traits.label: bottom-slots
traits.name: :bottom-slots
traits.desc: Enables bottom slots ('error', 'hint', 'counter')

traits.label: hide-bottom-space
traits.name: :hide-bottom-space
traits.desc: Do not reserve space for hint/error/counter anymore when these are not used; As a result, it also disables the animation for those; It also allows the hint/error area to stretch vertically based on its content

traits.label: counter
traits.name: :counter
traits.desc: Show an automatic counter on bottom right

traits.label: rounded
traits.name: :rounded
traits.desc: Applies a small standard border-radius for a squared shape of the component

traits.label: square
traits.name: :square
traits.desc: Remove border-radius so borders are squared; Overrides 'rounded' prop

traits.label: dense
traits.name: :dense
traits.desc: Dense mode; occupies less space

traits.label: item-aligned
traits.name: :item-aligned
traits.desc: Match inner content alignment to that of QItem

traits.label: disable
traits.name: :disable
traits.desc: Put component in disabled mode

traits.label: readonly
traits.name: :readonly
traits.desc: Put component in readonly mode

traits.label: autofocus
traits.name: :autofocus
traits.desc: Focus field on initial component render

traits.label: for
traits.name: :for
traits.desc: Used to specify the 'id' of the control and also the 'for' attribute of the label that wraps it; If no 'name' prop is specified, then it is used for this attribute as well

traits.label: shadow-text
traits.name: :shadow-text
traits.desc: Text to be displayed as shadow at the end of the text in the control; Does NOT applies to type=file

traits.label: type
traits.name: :type
traits.desc: Input type

traits.label: debounce
traits.name: :debounce
traits.desc: Debounce amount (in milliseconds) when updating model

traits.label: maxlength
traits.name: :maxlength
traits.desc: Specify a max length of model

traits.label: autogrow
traits.name: :autogrow
traits.desc: Make field autogrow along with its content (uses a textarea)

traits.label: input-class
traits.name: :input-class
traits.desc: Class definitions to be attributed to the underlying input tag

traits.label: input-style
traits.name: :input-style
traits.desc: Style definitions to be attributed to the underlying input tag
